Through its [[subsidiary|subsidiaries]] Beter Bed Holding N.V. trades in [[bedroom furniture]], [[mattress]]es and related products. In this line of business Beter Bed N.V is market leader in the Netherlands.<ref>{{cite web| url =http://www.bedden-site.nl/beter-bed| title =Beter bed; marktleider op het gebied van slaapkamers| accessdate =2009-03-28| language =Dutch}}</ref> Since 5 December 1996 Beter Bed's shares are being traded on the [[Amsterdam Stock Exchange]].<ref>{{Cite news | title =Beter Bed haalt met beursgang 125 miljoen op | newspaper = [[De Volkskrant]] | language = Dutch| pages = | year = | date = 1996-11-26 | url = http://www.volkskrant.nl/archief_gratis/article786161.ece | accessdate =2009-03-30}}</ref> However, Beter Bed does not belong to the group of companies that compose the [[AEX index]] but are part of the group that compose the [[AScX index|Amsterdam Small Cap Index]].
The [[corporate headquarters]] are in [[Uden]], in the Dutch [[Provinces of the Netherlands|province]] of [[North Brabant]]. Beter Bed Holding N.V. is the mother company of several different brands of [[chain store]]s, totalling 1072 shops in a number of [[Europe]]an countries. These companies operate in various [[market segment]]s, from [[Cash and carry (wholesale)|cash and carry]] products to exclusive bedroom furniture, each chain maintaining its own unique retail concept. The development and production of [[Orthopedic surgery|orthopedic]] mattresses is directed by the subsidiary DBC.
Beter Bed N.V. employs 2,227 [[full-time]] [[employee]]s in seven countries.
== History == Beter Bed was founded in 1981 in Uden by the brothers Mark and Pieter Diks. They raised capital from their father, Jan Diks, co-owner of [[Dico (company)|Dico]], managed to secure a modest bank loan and opened their first shop in Uden.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.forbes.com/global/1999/1101/0222056a_2.html|title=20 For 2000| accessdate =2009-05-02|publisher=forbes.com}}</ref> Shortly afterwards three shops, specialising in bedroom furniture, had been opened. At that time shops specialising in bedroom furniture and accompanying products were a new and unfamiliar phenomenon since this market segment was dominated by large [[department store]]s and specialist shops concentrating on general interiors. The concept of providing high quality goods and a wide range of products at a low price proved to be successful and was a blueprint for all future activities of Beter Bed. During the second half of the 1980s the company began to grow.<ref name="BeterBed">{{cite web |url=http://www.beterbedholding.nl/page.php?sm_id=42 |title=Beter Bed - History| accessdate =2009-03-27| format =|publisher=Beter Bed}}</ref>
1986 ''Bedden en Bedden B.V.'', a factory for the production of [[Medium-density fibreboard|MDF panels]], was established in Uden.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.beterbedholding.nl/page.php?sm_id=42 |title=Beter Bed - History| accessdate =2010-10-15| format =|publisher=Beter Bed}}</ref> In the 1990s two more production facilities were added to the company by acquiring two factories in Poland, ''Ecowood'' (1994) and ''Interwood'' (1996).<ref>{{cite web| url =http://www.fembusiness.nl/web/Bedrijven/Bedrijf.htm?dbid=66&typeofpage=66521| title =Beter Bed| accessdate =2009-03-29| language =Dutch}}</ref>
The [[Initial public offering|flotation]] of Beter Bed Holding N.V. took place in December 1996. [[Share (finance)|Shares]] of Beter Bed Holding N.V. are traded at the Amsterdam Stock Exchange. In the same year another company was added to the holding by the acquisition of ''DormaÃ«l'', a company that operates in the higher segment of the bedroom furniture market.<ref>{{Cite news | title = Beter Bed neemt Dormael over | newspaper = [[NRC Handelsblad]] | pages = | year = | date = 1996-12-20 | url =http://archief.nrc.nl/index.php/1996/November/20/Economie/20/Beter+Bed+neemt+Dormael+over | accessdate =2009-03-29| language =Dutch}}</ref> The following year ''Beter Baby'' was founded, with the goal to gain market shares in the trade with bedroom furniture for babies and small children. At the same time Beter Bed N.V. acquired ''DFC Comfort'' ensuring the sole right of representation for orthopedic mattresses and pillows by this company within the [[Benelux]].<ref name="BeterBed" />
In order to comply with the planned [[Economic expansion|expansion]] and the resulting requirements the company moved to a new location in January 1997, consisting of a larger administrative building and a [[distribution center|distribution centre]] with a surface of 16,000 mÂ², after a construction time of one year.<ref>{{Cite document|last= Beter Bed | title = Jaarverslag 1997 | year = 1998 | pages = 11 | place = Uden | publisher = Beter Bed Holding N.V.|language= Dutch}}</ref>
In the second half of the 1990s the subsidiary ''Bedden Dump'' was founded. Originally set up to sell items taken from the Beter Bed range via temporary shops, it was decided in 2002 to expand this formula into a [[discount store|discount chain]] for bedroom furniture according to a cash and carry concept, targeting the lower market segment.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.beterbedholding.nl//upload/doc/bbh2002uk.pdf |title=Beter Bed Holding N.V. Annual Report 2002| accessdate =2009-03-27| format =pdf |publisher=Beter Bed Holding}}</ref> In 2005 this company was renamed ''BeddenReus''.<ref name="BB 2006">{{cite web |url=http://www.beterbedholding.nl//upload/doc/Annual%20report%202006.pdf|title=Beter Bed Holding N.V. In 1998 the company expanded into [[Germany]] by opening the first two shops in [[Essen]] and [[Dortmund]]. Also in 1998 Beter Bed N.V. acquired the German company ''Matratzen Concord'' whose headquarters were based in [[Cologne]].<ref>{{Cite news | title = Beter Bed aast op Duitse matrassenspeciaalzaak | newspaper = De Volkskrant | language = Dutch | pages = | year = | date = 1998-12-29 | url = http://www.volkskrant.nl/archief_gratis/article786161.ece | accessdate =2009-03-30}}</ref> At the same time ''Matratzen Concord'' began its expansion into [[Austria]] and [[Switzerland]] (1998), as well as the Netherlands (1999), [[France]] and [[Italy]] (2000).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.beterbedholding.com/upload/doc/Annual%20results%201999.pdf|title=Beter Bed Holding N.V. The holding's structure began to change in 1999. One of the founding brothers, Pieter Diks, sold his remaining shares and retired from the management. Mark Diks again reduced his share in the company in May 2000 but remained in the management team for the time being.<ref>{{cite web| url =http://archief.fembusiness.nl/2000/10/21/nummer-43/Mark-Diks.htm| title =Mark Diks| accessdate =2009-03-29| language =Dutch}}</ref> Also in 2000 the production facility ''Bedden und Bedden'' was sold off<ref name="Beter Bed News" /> and the subsidiary ''DormaÃ«l'' was converted into a [[franchising]] formula. == Objectives == Whereas in 2001 the [[goal|objectives]] of Beter Bed N.V. were simply defined as aiming at fast and profitable expansion in the fragmented European bedroom furniture market whereby the various subsidiaries were supposed to endeavour to become market leaders in those countries they were active in on the one hand, and by developing [[Store brand|own brand]] products which were to be sold by the company's own retail chains as well as through other distribution channels on the other hand,<ref name="BB 2001" /> the objectives since 2009 have become more specific and detailed. The company now aims to strengthen further its alleged market leadership in Europe by positioning itself in such a way to make use of any possibility of [[economic growth|growth]]. Also, even though a temporary decrease in [[net profit]] is considered to be possible under exceptional circumstances, one of the goals is still to increase [[net profit]]. This is to be realised by adjusting various priorities. Furthermore, the target of an [[Earnings before interest and taxes|EBIT]] of 12,5% is to be retained as an objective, although the company admits that this will be unlikely in the near future if market conditions were to remain as they had been in 2008. Finally, in view of the uncertain market conditions Beter Bed N.V. considers an impeccable [[balance sheet]] and a strong [[cash flow]] to be vital to the strength and effectiveness of the company.<ref name="BB 2008" />
== Strategy == Beter Bed Holding's strategy for the realisation of the objectives is to ensure [[like for like]] growth in [[revenue]] at comparable shops and low investments per shop accompanied by flexibility in relation to [[renting|rental]] contracts. Secondly, the existing concept for shops is to be expanded, particularly outside the Netherlands. Additionally, the sales organisation is to be optimised and the sales methods improved through [[in-house]] [[training]]. Also, by utilising the company's [[Information technology|IT]] systems to its full capability information can be provided to which should enable Beter Bed N.V. to respond quickly to new [[Market trend|trends]] and opportunities and to make capacity adjustments in the event of changed market conditions. Finally, own product concepts are to be further to be developed by utilising technological developments in the field of mattress production and by responding to local trends in [[demand (economics)|demand]] of these products.<ref name="BB 2008" />
